title.narrative: INCREASED CAPACITY OF DUTY BEARERS TO USE RESEARCH AND BUDGET ANALYSIS

description.narrative: Duty-bearers at national and subnational levels have increased capacity to use research and budget analysis to plan efficient integrated programmes for multi-dimensionally deprived children., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 the poorest children in Rwanda benefit from a strengthened and adequately-resourced integrated social protection system

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC PLANNING MINECOFIN
NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF STATISTICS OF RWANDA NISR

Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Duty-bearers at national and subnational levels have increased capacity to use research and budget analysis to plan efficientintegrated programmes for multi-dimensionally deprived children.

description.narrative: The capacity of NISR technical staff was strengthened to analyse the 2019/20 RDHS data in the framework of a multidimensional and monetary child poverty analysis. UNICEF supported efforts to increase budget transparency by strengthening its partnership with MINECOFIN to increase the efficiency of public financial management (PFM) in priority areas for children. Financial resources were mobilized to expand collaboration with players and institutions involved in the PFM cycle and the fiscal transparency framework including CSOs, media, parliament, the Office of the Auditor General and most importantly, MINECOFIN.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2021
